decks.notes: This Bant Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cards that provide value through recursion, protection, and card advantage. The deck aims to maintain control of the board while applying pressure through efficient creatures and disruptive spells. Key cards like Eternal Witness, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Spellseeker help to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful removal like Swords to Plowshares and Solitude, as well as versatile cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Brainstorm to ensure consistency and flexibility in gameplay.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom alongside Nomads en-Kor and Shuko to quickly draw through the deck, finding key pieces like Kaldra Compleat and Force of Will to protect the combo. The inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Sword to Plowshares and Assimilation Aegis provide additional utility and protection. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to disrupt the opponent's spells, while cards like Prismatic Ending and Brazen Borrower offer removal options. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and includes necessary lands like Karakas and Cavern of Souls for protection and support.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, and then bringing them back with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The goal is to reanimate creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to gain control of the game. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and control the opponent's resources. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and bring them back from the graveyard for a quick victory.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Nomads en-Kor and Delighted Halfling in order to create infinite card draw and mana generation by targeting the Halfling with the Nomads' ability. Nadu, Winged Wisdom serves as the win condition by allowing the player to draw their entire deck, find Grist, the Hunger Tide, and then mill the opponent out. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo and control the board until the win condition can be achieved.

The deck revolves around utilizing fast mana and card draw to assemble a game-winning combo quickly. By generating mana with cards like Lotus Petal and Rite of Flame, as well as using cards like Lion's Eye Diamond for additional resources, the deck aims to cast powerful spells like Reforge the Soul or Echo of Eons to refill the hand and continue the combo. With the ability to search for key pieces using cards like Wish or Burning Wish, the deck can adapt to different situations and find the pieces needed to execute its chosen win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to use the "Balustrade Spy" and "Undercity Informer" creatures to mill cards from the top of your library into your graveyard, allowing you to win the game by either using "Thassa's Oracle" to win if your library is empty or by using "Dread Return" to bring back a powerful creature like "Boggart Trawler" or "Poxwalkers" from the graveyard. The deck also includes various spells like "Dark Ritual" and "Simian Spirit Guide" to generate mana quickly and enable explosive combo turns.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong tempo advantage through aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to disrupt the opponent's hand and mana development, as well as creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf to apply pressure, this deck aims to control the game and come out ahead. The inclusion of powerful spells like Force of Will and Brainstorm further solidify the deck's game plan of maintaining control and tempo advantage throughout the game.

The main objective of this deck is to assemble the Doomsday combo as quickly as possible to win the game. The key cards in this combo are Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle, which when combined correctly with the spells and mana sources in the deck, can guarantee a victory. The deck includes various cantrips and tutors to help find the necessary pieces, as well as protection in the form of Force of Will. The strategy revolves around carefully planning out the Doomsday stack and executing it at the right moment to outsmart the opponent and secure the win.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while developing its own board presence. It utilizes a combination of removal spells and creatures that disrupt the opponent's plans, along with powerful equipment to equip its creatures for an aggressive assault. The deck also includes cards that provide card advantage and value through effects such as blinking creatures and searching for specific cards. The mana base includes a variety of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful combo of Show and Tell to cheat in game-changing creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By quickly ramping up mana with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal, as well as controlling the board with counterspells like Force of Will, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Sneak Attack and Omniscience provide additional ways to cheat creatures into play, giving the deck multiple avenues to victory.

The deck focuses on using Nadu, Winged Wisdom in combination with Nomads en-Kor to draw cards and manipulate the top of the library effectively. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to protect the combo and control the game. The deck aims to create a strong card advantage engine while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a win through card advantage and control of the board.
